metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9444 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
In the Android kernel in sync debug fs driver there is a kernel pointer leak due to the usage of printf with %p. This could lead to local information disclosure with system execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
